methods.title: Static Positioning
methods.desc: All HTML elements are positioned statically by default. This means they are placed according to the normal flow of the document.

methods.title: Relative Positioning
methods.desc: Elements are positioned relative to their original position. Moving an element with position: relative does not affect the layout of other elements. top, right, bottom, left can be used to move the element.

methods.title: Absolute Positioning
methods.desc: The element is removed from the normal document flow and positioned relative to the nearest ancestor with a position other than static. top, right, bottom, left can be used to move the element.

methods.title: Fixed Positioning
methods.desc: The element is removed from the normal document flow and positioned relative to the browser window or viewport. It stays in place even when the page is scrolled. top, right, bottom, left can be used to move the element.

methods.title: Sticky Positioning
methods.desc: The element is treated as relatively positioned until it crosses a specified threshold, then it becomes fixed. top, right, bottom, left define when the element should stick.

methods.title: Z-Index
methods.desc: Controls the vertical stacking order of elements that overlap. Only works on positioned elements with position set to relative, absolute, fixed, or sticky. Elements with a higher z-index appear on top.
